file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-25-03-04 - RUDDER-POSITION MICROSWITCH HOLDER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RUDDER-POSITION MICROSWITCH HOLDER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the rudder-position-microswitch holder that are assembled on the rudder control system. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH rudder pedal assembly. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY RUDDER POSITION MICROSWITCHES - ALL 27-25-03-000-801-A REMOVAL RUDDER POSITION MICROSWITCHES - ALL 27-25-03-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-25-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-25-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. RUDDER POSITION MICROSWITCHES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the rudder-position microswitch holder assembly of the rudder control system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-12-06-000-801-A/400 PEDAL ASSEMBLY LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 27-25-02-000-801-A/400 RUDDER POSITION MICROSWITCHES - REMOVAL AMM TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A/400 COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Rudder-control mechanism on the cock- 223 223HZ pit floor Rudder control mechanism electrical 221 221DF connectors below the cockpit floor D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the rudder control system in the neu- GSE 058 Kit, rig pins, flight controls tral position E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is deenergized and safe for maintenance. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-25-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the pilot seat (AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove cockpit floor panel 221DF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100) ( AMM TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A/400). (4) Remove left pedal assembly lining 223HZ ( AMM TASK 25-12-06-000-801-A/400). (5) Open access door 123BL. (6) Install the rig pins to the rudder control system to lock it in the neutral position. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the rudder position microswitches according to AMM TASK 27-25-02-000-801-A/400. (2) Remove the bolt (6) and (8), washer (7), (9) and (12), and nut (10) and (11) to remove the microswitch support (14). (3) Remove the screw (1). (4) Remove the holder (2) from the support pedal (13). NOTE: Do not change the adjustment of the screws at the rudder-position microswitch stop to make the installation easier. (5) Remove the bolt (19), washer (18), (3) and (4), and nut (5). (6) Remove the stop pedal (17) and the bushing (16) from the support pedal (13). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-25-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Rudder-Position Microswitch Holder - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONES 221 1. SCREW (3) 223 DET. A 2. HOLDER 19. BOLT 3. WASHER 18. WASHER (2) 4. WASHER 5. NUT 17. STOP PEDAL 16. JUMPER 6. BOLT (2) 15. BUSHING 7. WASHER (2) 14. MICROSWITCH SUPPORT 8. BOLT (2) 9. WASHER (4) VIEW B 12. WASHER (6) 10. NUT (2) 11. NUT (2) 145AMM270607.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-25-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-25-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. RUDDER POSITION MICROSWITCHES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the rudder-position microswitch holder assembly of the rudder control system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-12-06-400-801-A/400 PEDAL ASSEMBLY LINING - INSTALLATION RUDDER PEDALS AUTOSHUTOFF AND RUDDER AMM TASK 27-25-00-700-801-A/500 MANUAL SHUTOFF FUNCTIONS- OPERATIONAL CHECK RUDDER POSITION MICROSWITCHES - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 27-25-02-400-801-A/400 TION RUDDER POSITION MICROSWITCHES - ADJUST- AMM TASK 27-25-02-700-801-A/500 MENT/TEST AMM TASK 53-01-01-400-801-A/400 COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Rudder control mechanism on the cock- 223 223HZ pit floor Rudder control mechanism electrical 221 221DF connectors below the cockpit floor D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the rudder control system in the neu- GSE 058 Kit rig pins, flight controls tral position E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-25-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the bushing (15) and position the stop pedal (17) to the support pedal. (2) Install the bolt (19), washer (18), jumper (16), washer (3) and (4), and nut (5). (3) Position the holder (2) to the support pedal (13). (4) Install the screw (1). (5) Position the microswitch support (14) on the support pedal (13) and install the bolt (6) and (8), washer (7), (9) and (12), and nut (10) and (11). (6) Install the rudder position microswitches according to AMM TASK 27-25-02-400-801-A/ 400. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the rig pins from the rudder control system. (2) Do a check on the rudder position microswitches (AMM TASK 27-25-02-700-801-A/ 500). (3) Do a check of the rudder pedals auto-shutoff and rudder manual shutoff functions ( AMM TASK 27-25-00-700-801-A/500). (4) Close access door 123BL. (5) Install the left pedal assembly lining 223HZ ( AMM TASK 25-12-06-400-801-A/400). (6) Install the cockpit floor panel 221DF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100) ( AMM TASK 53-01-01-400-801-A/400). (7) Install the pilot seat (AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-25-03 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
